__e: Depends where you are. A lot of people think that we-- working in the Sonderkommando-- we were guilty of something... because we were doing such kind of a work.
"We are all guilty... of everything and everyone... and me more than the others." I forget who said that.
Then they're guilty of something else, all I'm saying.
They were all guilty and still on the street, and you know that.
And through that lens, it becomes so much easier to accept that they're guilty and that they should go to prison.
- No. Believe me, this is not the time for blame or panic.
I'd rather have you feeling guilty than them feeling guilty about you.
Not to ourselves, not to each other, not to our beautiful, beautiful little girl because we aren't to blame for this.
That kid is a picture in a newspaper who makes us feel bad for having it so good.
I'm not saying that you all are culprits but someone is there.
ZELDA: You were both at fault, but if it'll get rid of you any faster,
